original_solution_mapping.L1: He needs food for 21 days because 3 x 7 = <<3*7=21>>21
original_solution_mapping.L2: The puppy will eat 7 cups of food because 21 x (1/3) = <<21*(1/3)=7>>7
original_solution_mapping.L3: He needs 2 bags of food because 7 / 3.5 = <<7/3.5=2>>2

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7307.
    Returns: the total cost for Mark.
    """
    # L1
    weeks_of_food = 3 # enough food for 3 weeks
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    total_days_food_needed = weeks_of_food * days_per_week

    # L2
    food_per_day = Fraction(1, 3) # puppy eats 1/3 cup of food a day
    total_cups_eaten = total_days_food_needed * food_per_day

    # L3
    cups_per_bag = 3.5 # A bag of food with 3.5 cups
    num_bags_needed = total_cups_eaten / cups_per_bag

    # L4
    cost_per_bag = 2 # costs $2
    total_food_cost = num_bags_needed * cost_per_bag

    # L5
    puppy_cost = 10 # puppy that cost $10
    total_overall_cost = puppy_cost + total_food_cost

    # FA
    answer = total_overall_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He needs food for {total_days_food_needed} days because {weeks_of_food} x {days_per_week} = <<{weeks_of_food}*{days_per_week}={total_days_food_needed}>>{total_days_food_needed}
The puppy will eat {total_cups_eaten} cups of food because {total_days_food_needed} x ({food_per_day}) = <<{total_days_food_needed}*({food_per_day})={total_cups_eaten}>>{total_cups_eaten}
He needs {num_bags_needed} bags of food because {total_cups_eaten} / {cups_per_bag} = <<{total_cups_eaten}/{cups_per_bag}={num_bags_needed}>>{num_bags_needed}
The food will cost him ${total_food_cost} because {num_bags_needed} x {cost_per_bag} = <<{num_bags_needed}*{cost_per_bag}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost}
It will cost ${total_overall_cost} in total because {puppy_cost} + {total_food_cost} = <<{puppy_cost}+{total_food_cost}={total_overall_cost}>>{total_overall_cost}
